member.name: P:Cronitor.Attributes.QueryStringPropertyAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Attributes.QueryStringPropertyAttribute.Lower
member.summary: Convert property to lower case.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Environment
member.summary: The environment the telemetry event is being sent from. Use this for monitors that are running in multiple environments (e.g. staging and production). Alerting can be configured per environment.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Host
member.summary: The hostname of the server sending the telemetry event.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Message
member.summary: A url-encoded message of up to 2000 characters.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Metric
member.summary: Performance related metrics. Must be one of: count:* - record counts of important events. duration:* - the duration of the job/task being monitored. error_count:* - the number of errors that occurred

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Series
member.summary: A unique user-supplied ID to collate related pings, i.e. matching state=run and state=complete|fail to one another. If a job is pinging very frequently (every 2-3s or faster), it will greatly improve matching accuracy.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Commands.Command.Status
member.summary: Exit code returned from a background job.

member.name: M:Cronitor.Cronitor.Configure(System.String)
member.summary: Configures the instance. Must be called before any other methods.

member.name: M:Cronitor.Internals.Service.Configure(System.String)
member.summary: Configures the instance. Must be called before any other methods.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.Key
member.summary: The unique identifier for this issue.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.Name
member.summary: The display name of this issue. Used to identify the issue in alerts, within the Cronitor application, and, if published, on your status page(s).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.Environment
member.summary:
The key of the environment this issue is assigned to. To view your full list of current environment keys,
see: https://cronitor.io/app/settings/environments

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.Severity
member.summary: The severity of the issue. Used within the Cronitor application, and, if published, on your status page(s).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.State
member.summary: The current state of the issue. Used within the Cronitor application, and, if published, on your status page(s).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.Started
member.summary: An ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue started, e.g. 2023-06-02T09:39:31Z

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.AssignedTo
member.summary: Must be a member of your Cronitor team. An email notification will be sent.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.StatusPages
member.summary: An optional list of status pages where this issue should be published. Each list entry should be the key of an active status page in your account.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.AffectedComponents
member.summary:
An optional list of affected status page components that this issue should be associated with. Each list entry should be the key of an active status page component in your account.
Note: The affected component must belong to a status page included in statuspages.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.CreatedAt
member.summary: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue was created.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issue.UpdatedAt
member.summary: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue was created.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issues.Event.Key
member.summary: The unique identifier for this event.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issues.Event.Timestamp
member.summary: An ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue started, e.g. 2023-06-02T09:39:31Z

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issues.Event.State
member.summary: The current state of the issue. Used within the Cronitor application, and, if published, on your status page(s).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issues.Event.CreatedAt
member.summary: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue was created.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Issues.Event.UpdatedAt
member.summary: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the issue was created.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Key
member.summary:
A monitor’s unique identifier. The key is used in making API requests to an individual monitor resource, e.g. https://cronitor.io/api/monitors/:monitorKey
It is also the required identifier for sending telemetry events.https://cronitor.link/ping/API_KEY/:monitorKey

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Name
member.summary: The display name of this monitor. Used to identify your monitor in alerts and within the Cronitor application.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.GraceSeconds
member.summary: The number of seconds that Cronitor should wait after detecting a failure before dispatching an alert. If the monitor recovers during the grace period no alert will be sent.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Group
member.summary: Groups are user-defined collections of monitors, that are used to group monitors in the Cronitor application. Each group has a unique URL with the format https://cronitor.io/app/groups/:groupKey

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Metadata
member.summary:
A JSON serializable set of arbitrary key/value pairs that contain useful information about a job.
For example, cronitor-kubernetes stores fields like backoffLimit and startingDeadlineSeconds.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Note
member.summary: A useful place to provide additional context/troubleshooting information about the job/system being monitored. The note is sent in alerts (excluding SMS), and are accessible from the monitor details view in the Cronitor application.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Notify
member.summary:
Configure where alerts sent when Cronitor detects an error. Additionally, notify can be used to specify occurrence based alerts - alerts based on receiving telemetry pings.
All accounts have a default Notification List(key= "default"). If notify is left empty or omitted, the default list will be used.
Array: An array of Notification List keys. Notification Lists are used for configuring how alerts are sent to your team. "notify": [‘devops-channel’]
Hash: To specify separate notification preferences a hash containing the keys "alerts" and "events" can be used.
The "alerts" key accepts an array of Notification List keys. The "events" key accepts a hash with keys corresponding to the lifecycle telemetry events - run, complete.If these keys are set to true, Cronitor will send a notification when the event occurs. { "notify": { "alerts": [‘foo-bar’], "events": { "complete": true} }

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Platform
member.summary: The platform attribute is used in conjunction with the type attribute to tell Cronitor about where and how a monitor is being run beyond.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.AlertInterval
member.summary:
Interval expression telling Cronitor how long to wait before sending follow up alerts after a monitor fails (and does not recover).
If an integer is provided it will be interpreted as `X hours`
After 10 alerts, Cronitor will mute alerting until the monitor recovers.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.ScheduleTolerance
member.summary: Number of missed scheduled executions to allow before sending an alert.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Tags
member.summary: Tags are user provided strings that can be used to associate and filter monitors in the Cronitor dashboard. Use tags however you would like.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Timezone
member.summary: The timezone your system is running in.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Type
member.summary:
The type attribute determines which of Cronitor's monitoring capabilities are used to assess the health of your system. Based on the type provided, other attributes may be required — e.g. the checks type requires the request attribute to be set.
jobs monitor the execution of a backend job(cron job, windows scheduled task, etc). This involves tracking the lifecycle of the job - the start_time, end_time and exit_state of the job.
events monitor the health of a system via telemetry events.There is no lifecycle to measure, the occurrence (or absence) of healthy/unhealthy events, as well as data passed as custom metrics are used to determine the health of an event monitor.
checks monitor websites, APIs, proxy servers, cloud storage providers(e.g.S3) or any other HTTP/TCP/UDP networked device.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Disabled
member.summary: Whether the monitor is currently disabled.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Initialized
member.summary: Whether the monitor has received a telemetry event.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Passing
member.summary: Whether the monitor is currently passing or failing.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Paused
member.summary: Whether sending alerts is currently paused.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.Running
member.summary: Whether a job is running (only applicable for type: job).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Monitor.CreatedAt
member.summary: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp of when the monitor was created.

member.name: T:Cronitor.Models.Notifications
member.summary: Where/how you wish to be contacted when alerting is triggered. The following key/value pairs are all options, at least one of which must not be empty. Note that notification lists cannot be included recursively. Monitors can, however, use and extend multiple notification lists. This gives you flexibility to create focused Notification List that can be composed into your desired notification strategies.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Notifications.Emails
member.summary: A list of emails to send alerts to.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Notifications.Pagerduty
member.summary: A list of pagerduty keys (found on account settings page).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Notifications.Phones
member.summary: A list of phone numbers to send SMS alerts to.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Notifications.Slack
member.summary: A list of slack webhook URLs (found on account settings page).

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Notifications.Webhooks
member.summary: A list of URLs (prefixed with http:// or https://) to callback to.

member.name: T:Cronitor.Models.Ping
member.summary:
Retrieve correlated ping and alert history in reverse chronological order.
Note: Old pings are pruned regularly. Note: The values returned will vary based on the type of monitor. For example, on cron/heartbeat monitors your server IP will be available in the from field, on healthcheck monitors this field is used to display the location of our server performing the healthcheck.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Timestamp
member.summary: Decimal timestamp

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.MonitorName
member.summary: The display name of the monitor

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.MonitorKey
member.summary: The unique identifier

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Description
member.summary: Enum(alert, healthcheck, ping)

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.From
member.summary: Healthchecks: The location we pinged from Heartbeat: The IP the ping was received from. Alert: None.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Message
member.summary: Healthchecks: The description of the check Heartbeat: The supplied ?msg, or an empty string. Alert: Failure description.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Event
member.summary: Healthchecks: null Heartbeat: enum(run, complete, fail) Alert: enum(failure, recovery)

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Status
member.summary: Healthchecks: The result of the healthcheck Heartbeat: None Alert: None

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.Duration
member.summary: Healthchecks: The response time of your healthcheck Heartbeat: None Alert: None

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Ping.CreatedAt
member.summary: A datetime display of the provided stamp.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.Url
member.summary: The URL of the resource to monitor.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.Method
member.summary: The HTTP request method: GET, HEAD, PATCH, POST, PUT

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.Body
member.summary: The request body. Required for PUT, PATCH, and POST requests.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.Headers
member.summary: The HTTP headers of the request (e.g. User-Agent). Limited to 5120 chars.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.Cookies
member.summary: Cookies to set before each request. Limited to 5120 chars.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Request.TimeoutSeconds
member.summary: The timeout enforced when making the request. An alert will be triggered upon timeout.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.Key
member.summary: The unique identifier for this list. May contain letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.Name
member.summary: The name of your Notification List

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.Monitors
member.summary: A list of monitors attached to this Notification List.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.Notifications
member.summary: Where/how you wish to be contacted when alerting is triggered. The following key/value pairs are all options, at least one of which must not be empty. Note that notification lists cannot be included recursively. Monitors can, however, use and extend multiple notification lists. This gives you flexibility to create focused Notification List that can be composed into your desired notification strategies.

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.Status
member.summary: A plain text status description of this monitor

member.name: P:Cronitor.Models.Template.CreatedAt
member.summary: ISO formatted string of when the Notification List was created
